channel.title: I'm thinking about doing a program
channel.description:
Introduction: I am thinking about doing a program which assigns hotkeys. What are hotkeys?------>they are something you press to activate something.
Why? I was thinking,why do we need to keep pressing 'mozilla firefox'?Why can't we activate it from a hotkey?
How? I'm very noobish at this kind of stuff,so I have a couple of problems. 1)is there anyway to activate a program? 2)Would disabling it with a remote key eg.Esc work?Or would it be more of a pain than anything?
I'll be using the [code]symbol = myScanner.findInLine( " . " ).CharAt(0) ;[/code] and [code]if,while or do[/code] processes.(the first piece of code finds a particular input from your (keyboard?).)So, this fits in with my project...
In case you haven't noticed,this is a plea for help... Please try to help me as much as you can... Suggestions welcome

item.title: I'm thinking about doing a program
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Pirate, you don’t know anything about programming, stfu.

Although, you’d need to learn the JNI interface to do to much with a system.
C++ isn’t multiplatformed either.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm thinking about doing a program
item.dc:creator: @the_one1 the one
item.description:
@the_one1 wrote:

Thank you all for your comments.
Bobdole,which programming language would you recommend?You talk about not able to be done in pure java?Is there a way to combine languages?Sorry if this sounds extremely stupid…
Frank_, that was extremely hurtful,as I said,I’m trying to make a program.I want to sharpen my skills.I don’t care if it can be done in explorer.

Read full topic
item.source: I'm thinking about doing a program

item.title: I'm thinking about doing a program
item.dc:creator: @Kryptizzler Kryptizzler
item.description:
@Kryptizzler wrote:

Scanner works by getting input to the console. You need to type the input and then press enter. << Not a good idea.

SCAR… not a good idea either. It would totally defeat the purpose of opening a program with a key because you’d need to open SCAR and run the script.

Read full topic

@the_one1 wrote:

Introduction:
I am thinking about doing a program which assigns hotkeys.
What are hotkeys?------>they are something you press to activate something.

Why?
I was thinking,why do we need to keep pressing ‘mozilla firefox’?Why can’t we activate it from a hotkey?

How?
I’m very noobish at this kind of stuff,so I have a couple of problems.
1)is there anyway to activate a program?
2)Would disabling it with a remote key eg.Esc work?Or would it be more of a pain than anything?

I’ll be using the

symbol = myScanner.findInLine( " . " ).CharAt(0) ;

and

if,while or do

processes.(the first piece of code finds a particular input from your (keyboard?).)So, this fits in with my project…

In case you haven’t noticed,this is a plea for help…
